message: Viber is cool, but it doesn't call out.
What I already found: Skype, Fring, Talkatone.
GeeVee works fine.
What else do we have?
Truphone.
what did you find lacking in the ones you've listed?
What's wrong with Skype?
Skype eats battery. Fring is too slow. Talkatone requires Google Voice. All of them have low sound quality. (Quality of Skype and Viber is perfect)
anyone tried new stuff from betamax ilke nonoh iPhone app?
Skype skype skype
@romanzolotarev whoa dude, nitpicky much? it's like complaining that Ferrari use too much fuel. Prius is too quiet. X5 requires diesel. All of them drives badly (except for ferrari and bmw)
i feel like in the voip world (or even telco in general) we have a decent options for the whole spectrum... there's no such thing as 1 solution for everything, never will.
skype... since i don't use skype in, i set it so it doesn't run on background
@unwrangle I'm agree with you on “whole spectrum”. What app do you use for international calls from iPhone (if any)?
Actually I'm happy with Skype+Viber. :) But did I miss something else?
Thank you guys.
@unwrangle I see. Same with me (SkypeOut and Viber on background).

I cant help you on an iphone but for my android i use SipDroid in conjunction with my own personal asterisk server. 

Basically i vpn from my handset to my asterisk server and then use my regular office line to dial out from there - it treats my android handset as a regular extension to my home pabx which is cool because i can use my Australian/UK or USA outbound voip lines to make calls OR when people are trying to reach me and i'm out on my cell the calls to the Australian/UK lines also ring on my cell phone.

If you've never checked out Asterisk before go to www.Cognation.net/Asterisk where i have a 60 seconds newbie guide.
@romanzolotarev, Talkatone is co-founded by your old buddy @dayanov ;)
Convore is a great place for great people! @ddayanov, Hi Danis. How are you doing?
i think it works ok
use tango
but the title says VoIP app, Google Voice isn't a VoIP app, google voice is more of a proxy then a hub for calling
skype has very low prices for international calling
Skype is 20% more expensive than Google Voice on most direction.
*directions.
Ok. I can make calls from Talkatone via Google Voice.
@romanzolotarev, pretty good. Google Voice is internally all VoIP and can be used to make calls/texts over WiFi or 3G connection if paired with Google Talk.
